H0.text: Wind energy is produced when coal is burned and converted to supply energy for homes.

H1.text: Nuclear energy is the energy coal can be burned and converted to for homes.

H2.text: Electrical energy is produced by burning coal and converting it for homes.

H3.text: Solar energy is the energy that coal can be burned and converted to for homes.

A4.text: Coal-fired power stations convert chemical energy stored in coal successively into thermal energy, mechanical energy and, finally, electrical energy.

A5.text: The furnace heat converts boiler water to steam, which is then used to spin turbines that turn generators.
